workflow.name: Automate RSS-to-social media with AI summaries and image generation
workflow.description:
## How it works

This workflow automates publishing content from any RSS feed directly to Facebook and Instagram.
It reads new RSS entries, extracts the article content, generates a short social-media-friendly summary using an AI model, and then creates an AI-generated image based on the topic.
The post is uploaded to Facebook and Instagram (via Graph API) and logged in Google Sheets for reference.
Finally, a Telegram bot sends you a notification with links to the published posts.

## Set up steps
	1.	Insert your RSS feed URL in the RSS Feed Trigger node.
	2.	Configure Google Sheets credentials and replace the example sheet with your own.
	3.	In Supabase Config, insert your Supabase URL and bucket name.
	4.	In Facebook/Instagram nodes, replace [INSERT_YOUR_SITE_ID] with your own page or account ID.
	5.	Connect your Facebook Graph API credentials (remove hardcoded tokens).
	6.	Connect your OpenAI / Anthropic / Gemini credentials for text and image generation.
	7.	Set up your Telegram Bot credentials if you want to receive notifications.

## Notes
	‚Ä¢	Sticky notes inside the workflow explain each section (RSS trigger, filtering, content generation, posting, logging, notifications).
	‚Ä¢	No credentials are saved in the template ‚Äì you must connect your own before running.
	‚Ä¢	All generated content (text + images) is fully automated but can be customized (e.g. change AI prompts for your preferred style).

messageValues.message: Step into the role of a technology blog editor. You will receive an article. Your task is to summarize it in 5 sentences. Use the English language. At the end, encourage discussion or comments in a natural way. Skip unnecessary remarks. You may use a maximum of 3 emojis in the entire post. Add the source (name of the service) and 5 hashtags.

parameters.text: =Generate a prompt for Open AI Image Generation to create a professional image for social media (Facebook, Instagram) on this TOPIC: {{ $json.text }}. The image should be engaging, suitable for a technology blog, for example photorealistic shots of experts in the office, in the field, photos of specific devices, technologies, or concepts described in the article. The images should be aesthetic and evoke positive feelings. The subject and appearance of the image must be closely related to the given TOPIC. Remember, this is a prompt that will later be pasted into the body in the API, so avoid elements that may break the JSON (you cannot use quotation marks). Generate only the prompt, without introduction, without quotation marks. The entire message must be less than 1000 characters.

parameters.content:
## RSS Trigger
Paste a RSS channel URL here

## Filtering used content
If the URL has not been processed (row does not exist in Google Sheets), the workflow will proceed.

## Saving Image to Supabase
Uploads the image to Supabase Storage.
Set your bucket name in the Set node or via JSON.

## Text extraction
The contents of the article gets extracted.

## Post generation
A summary of the article is written by Claude.

## Image Generation
A prompt for image generation is created based on the Claude's summary and an image is generated in the OpenAI Image Generator.

# Posting to Facebook & Instagram
Remember to paste your unique site ID

# Collect and organize data
Information about generated posts gets saved to Google Sheets.

# Send a report via Telegram
Information about published posts gets sent by a Telegram bot.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
